kill verb
(DEATH)
A2 [ I or T ] to cause someone or something to die: Her parents were killed in a plane crash. Smoking can kill. Food must be heated to a high temperature to kill harmful bacteria.

kill verb
(FINISH)
C2 [ T ] to stop or destroy a relationship, activity, or experience: Lack of romance can kill a marriage. They gave her some tablets to kill the pain. Kill your speed.
[ T ] mainly US informal (also kill off) to drink all of something: We killed off two six-packs watching the game.
